#Text=Avoid Stock Option Mistakes
#Text=Options like Stocks take time to learn .
#Text=Here are the basic reasons why people lose money in options and how you can avoid them .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Avoid buying Calls or Puts with High Volatility because they are overpriced .
#Text=If you plot a stock on BigCharts or StockCharts , you can select an upper indicator called " Bollinger Bands " on a " Weekly " chart .

column1: #Text=If the Bands are wide , the volatility is high and the options are " Overpriced " .
#Text=Avoid buying these options because stocks fluctuate between high volatility and low volatility , so when the volatility cools off , the options will fall in price and you will have lost money .
#Text=Consider " selling " options that have high volatility and are overpriced .
#Text=Avoid Options that are " out of the money " because they lose a lot of time value and have a higher risk of expiring worthless if the stock does not move in the direction you want .

column1: #Text=You can just as easily buy options that are deep in the money because they will have less time value ( less overpriced ) and will follow the stock price more closely .
#Text=Buy Leaps instead of options that expire in a few months .
#Text=If you buy leaps , the time decay per month is low and the price you pay per week is far less .
#Text=Options have the fastest time decay when they are close to expiration so do n't buy options that expire in a few weeks or months .
#Text=Avoid buying calls after the stock has jumped in price .
#Text=If you buy a call after a rally , the chance of a pullback and the option losing price is the greatest .
#Text=Also the volatility is high so you " overpay " for the options .
#Text=I try and buy the options after a fall and when the volatility is low so that the options will be cheap .
#Text=Only put 5 % of your money in an option at a time .
#Text=This way if the option falls in half you will not be under any stress because you only lost 2.5 % .
#Text=If you put a lot of money in an option and the market moves against you , you will get cold feet and sell at a loss .
#Text=Then if you sold and the stock rallies , you will wonder why you sold at a loss .
#Text=Work this in reverse and only put a lot of money in an option that is deep in the money on a dip .
#Text=It takes time to get your timing right and if you lose a lot of money , you will be tempted to take greater risks and have a greater chance of losing more money .
#Text=There is money to be made by taking " less " risk but you have to conserve cash to get to the point where you can get your timing right .
#Text=Tips
#Text=You can plot option prices on bigcharts by going to " advanced chart " , plot the stock , select " option chain " ( 2 inches above the chart ) , then selecting " quote " .
#Text=By charting the option you can get an idea of its pattern and avoid mistakes .
#Text=You can measure volatility to determine if an option is overpriced by selecting " bollinger bands " on stockcharts or bigcharts .
#Text=You must select " weekly " graphs because " daily " graphs fluctuate too wildly and are harder to see the patterns and harder to interpret .
#Text=On StockCharts you can change the chart " type " from " candlesticks " to " Elder Impulse System " ( but you will have to scroll down to the bottom of the list to select it . )
#Text=This is an advanced formula where the stock is green when you should be owning calls and red when you should be owning puts .
#Text=This keeps you going in the right direction and helps your timing .
#Text=If you make a lot of money on a trade , withdraw 30 % of the money and pay bills .
#Text=This way if you give back a lot of money on some bad trades , you will at least have paid down bills and be in a better position to withstand a downturn .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Options are risky and you should not put more than 5 % of your money in an option at a time .
#Text=This way you conserve cash for the really good trades .
#Text=If you make a lot of money on a trade in a non-ira account , be sure and withdraw the money to pay for taxes and save it for tax time .
#Text=It is a lot of hassle to lose money in the beginning of the next year and not have the money to pay for taxes .
